number.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a word or sign that represents an exact amount or quantity
number.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: They wrote various numbers on a large sheet of paper.
A hundred pounds is a good round number.
number.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Sorry, you have the wrong number.
I gave him my home number.
number.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a number used to show the position of something in an ordered set or list
number.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a set of numbers used to name or recognize someone or something
number.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Did you get the number  (=registration number) of the car?
What is your account number, please?
Press 1 to change the printer number.
number.translation[0].definitions[4].def: an amount of something that can be counted
number.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: The number of cars on our roads rose dramatically last year.
We have been friends for a number of years.
The condors have dwindled to an estimated sixty in number.
number.translation[0].definitions[4].not: You use a singular verb after the number of
The number of people is increasing
You use a plural verb after a number of (=several)
A number of issues  were discussed
number.translation[0].definitions[5].def: a piece of popular music that forms part of a longer performance
number.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: Madonna sang several numbers from her latest album.
number.translation[0].definitions[6].def: a copy of a magazine or newspaper printed on a particular date
number.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: I was reading the latest number of ‘Surfing’.
number.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: They wanted to choose a leader from among their own number.
Only three of our number could speak Italian.
number.translation[0].definitions[8].def: the form of a word, depending on whether one thing or more than one thing is being talked about
number.translation[0].definitions[8].exa: ‘Horses’ is plural in number, while ‘horse’ is singular.
number.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: – Meaning 1: a word or sign that represents an exact amount or quantity
number.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: All even numbers can be divided by 2.
You can’t work in pairs if you’ve got an odd number of people.
A hundred is a nice round number.
Maths is easier if you are dealing with positive numbers.
Can a negative number have a square root?
After 7, what is the next prime number?
Numbers go on to infinity, so there is no last cardinal number.
The children learn about position and ordinal numbers when they stand in a line.
Add the two numbers together and divide by three.
Write all the numbers down, then add them up.
Subtract this number from the total.
What happens if you multiply a positive number by a negative number?
You can’t divide a prime number by any other number, except 1.
number.translation[0].note_box[1].headin: – Meaning 5: an amount of something that can be counted
number.translation[0].note_box[1].sectio: a large/great number
A large number of children were running around in the playground.
a vast/huge number
We’ve had a huge number of complaints.
a high number
There seems to be no reason for the high number of suicides.
a considerable/substantial/significant number
He received a substantial number of votes.
A considerable number of students left after the first year.
a good number
He has written a good number of books for children.
a small number
The class had only a small number of students.
a low number
the low numbers of women involved in sports coaching
a limited number
A limited number of copies were printed.
a tiny number
Only a tiny number of these animals remain in the wild.
a growing/increasing number
An increasing number of women are entering the profession.
increase the number of something
As you improve, increase the number of times you do each exercise.
reduce the number of something
We need to reduce the number of cars on the road.
a number increases/goes up/grows/rises
The number of mobile phones has increased dramatically.
a number doubles
The number of road accidents has doubled in the last ten years.
a number falls/drops/goes down/decreases/declines
The number of new houses being built is falling steadily.
a number halves
The number of children failing at school has halved in recent years.
in large/increasing/limited etc numbers
Birds nest here in large numbers.
any number of something
There have been any number of magazine articles about the celebrity couple.
bring the number to 25,120 etc
This will bring the number of jobs lost at the company to 85.
number.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to give a number to something that is part of an ordered set or list
number.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: They haven’t numbered the pages of the report.
All the seats in the theatre are numbered.
number.translation[1].definitions[1].def: if people or things number a particular amount, that is how many there are
number.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The population of the town numbered about 5,000.
The men on strike now number 5% of the workforce.
number.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a series of numbers used to identify someone or something
number.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: He checked the number on the file.
Your account number is the last set of numbers on the bottom of your cheque.
Please quote your credit card number in all correspondence.
number.translation[2].definitions[1].def: how many people there are in a particular situation, activity etc
number.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: Airline passenger numbers in America have more than doubled.
a 25 percent increase in staff numbers
number.translation[2].definitions[2].def: figures or amounts, for example those in a company’s accounts or in statistics
number.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: The numbers told the story: the marketing strategy was a success.
If you run the numbers (=do the necessary calculations), there is no way you can make money renting the space at $30 a square foot.
number.translation[2].definitions[3].exa: The number of companies created in the first half of this year was 3.1% lower than last year.
number.translation[2].definitions[4].def: the most important person or thing, the second most important etc in an organization or group
number.translation[2].definitions[4].exa: Mr Steed is number two to the group chief executive.
number.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to be a particular amount or quantity
number.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: At that time, its employees numbered nearly 4,000.
Sales numbered 8.1% fewer than a year before.
number.translation[3].definitions[1].def: to give a number to things that are part of a set or list
number.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: Each doll is individually numbered and comes with a certificate of authenticity.
